result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Allan Arnett

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 9:38 AM Defendant Michael Allan Arnett in court, in custody.  Attorney Heidi E. Brewer appeared by video for Michael Allan Arnett.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew J Tingstad appeared by Zoom audio only for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case, cites appearances.  Per Atty Brewer, def has recieved a copy of the criminal complaint and has been advised of the charges and potential maximum penalties.  Def waives formal reading of the criminal complaint, reserving all challenges as to form and jurisdiction.  Def waives T/L for prelim.  PTC to be set.  11/7 at 11:55 a.m.  Court explains PTC to def.  No questions.  Adj.  9:42 a.m.  klr

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 11:05 a.m.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Def appears in person, in custody.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears in person for the State of WI.  Court provides background.  Def indicates he is unable to post.  Def states he qualifies for the public def but since no case had been filed, unable to appoint.  Court reads charges.  Def reads full reading of complaint.  Court explains prelim, etc.  Def has no mailing address yet.  Def does not with to request prelim within timeframe at this time due to not having counsel.  Initial appearance continued to Monday, 10/24 at 9:00 a.m.  Adj.  11:08 a.m.  klr

ARNETT, MICHAEL:  Bond Hearing/PC Hearing:  1:58 p.m.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Michael A. Arnett appears in person, in custody.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Court explains PC hearing process.  PC statement provided to Court.  Def understands.  Court explains process for court appointed atty.  Def understands.  Sgt. J. Colassaco sworn in, direct by DA.  Sgt. IDs def.  Court finds PC.  DA requests bond of $500 cash.  Class H felony.  Court questions def.  Def indicates he can't post any cash.  Court sets $2,000 cash bond.  Def not to leave WI or U.P.  Contact info to be provided prior to release.  Def is to have no contact with owner of veh.  Initial App on 10/24 at 9:00 a.m.  klr
